chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodney E Kuehl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
in Wisconsin State Prison System - IMPOSED AND STAYED.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed
3 years Extended Supervision - IMPOSED AND STAYED.
shall be installed on any motor vehicle owned and/or operated by defendant.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay fine, costs, blood draw fee and DNA surcharge within 60 days (4/25/16) through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office or establish a payment plan within said time.
Defendant shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.  Defendant shall successfully attend an OWI Victim Impact Panel within 120 days of conviction.

timeConds.notes:
in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer to commence immediately. Huber is for employment and treatment.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rodney E Kuehl in court with attorney Daniel P Fay.  Gilbert G. Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court conducts Arraignment; reading of Amended Information waived; Def. will plead; Court reviews recomm.; Court reviews charge/penalties; Def. pleads Guilty to BAC6th; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; stip. to facts; Court finds plea made FVK&I and finds Def. guilty of BAC6th w/OAR D&RI; State heard; ADA Sempf takes over for ADA Thompson; Atty. Fay heard; Def. makes statement; Court imposes sentence

**Impose and stay 6 years Prison w/3 years IC and 3 years ES - 3 years years PO
- 1 year in DCJ w/H&Tr. to comm. immediately - Huber for employment and treatment
- $2400 F+C = $3,801 w/in 60 days
- $250 DNA surcharge and sample
- $33.60 Hartford blood draw
- AODA & FT
- Def. must be actively involved in treatment, including WEEKLY treatment
- VIP w/in 120 days
- absolute sobriety, no bars
- not drive w/o valid WI driver's license

* 36 mo. Rev. & IID

from Atty Fay re: next hearing
Modified condition from No Driving to No Driving without a License. All other conditions remain.

Defendant Rodney E Kuehl in court with attorney Daniel P Fay.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim set. Parties heard on motion to modify bond. Court modifies bond to no driving w/o license; all other conditions remain.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

10:40 - Defendant Rodney E Kuehl in court with attorney Daniel P Fay (stated for this hearing ONLY).  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Fay requesting adjourned Initial Appearance. Discussion held. Court allows adjourned Initial, will set out 2 weeks. Court finds probable cause. ADA Sempf heard on bond - requesting cash. Atty Fay heard. Court heard and sets $5000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.
